Parameters:pnum (int) – the port number

Return type:int the MIDIin port
print_lines(length, lines)¶

Print ## lines with 0.2 sec delay

Parameters:
  • length (int) – the line length (actuel length is 1 longer)
  • lines (int) – number of lines to print (-1)

Parameters:length (int) – the line length (actual length is 1 longer)

Parameters:midinumber (int) – the midinumber that is played
stopSC(midinumber)¶

If midinumber is 66, then stop SuperCollider

By issueing a cmd-. command.

Parameters:midinumber (int) – the midinumber pressed on the keyboard

__init__(debug=True)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

conditional(conditional_num)¶

Setup a conditional

There are three options: settimg up a conditional if number of notes played is more than 100 in … (option 1), setting up a conditional if range is more than … (option 2), and setting up a conditional if range is less than … (option 3).

Parameters:conditional_num (int) – the selection for the type of conditional
customPass(name, content)¶

post custom string message on codespace and display

Parameters:
  • name (string) – a label to print in front of the string
  • content (string) – the message or content

formatAndSendUDP(msg='', encoding='utf-8', host='localhost', display=1, syntax_color='', spacing=True)¶

format and prepare a string for sending it over UDP socket

param str msg:the string to be sent
param str encoding:
 the character encoding
param str host:the UDP server hostname
param int display:
 the UDP destination port
param str syntax_color:
 the tag to use for syntax coloring (loop, primitive, mid, low, hi, snippet)
param boolean spacing:
 wheather to put a

(new line) before the msg

miniSnippets(snippet_num, pianosection)¶

Type a mini snippet for specific pianosections’utf-8’

Parameters:
  • snippet_num (int) – the id of the mini snippet to play
  • pianosections (string) – the pianosection that is used (‘hi’, ‘mid’, ‘low’)
onlyDisplay(content, tag=1, warning=False)¶

print a custom string on the UDP display only!

Parameters:
  • content (string) – the message or content
  • tag (int) – the reference to a color tag
  • warning – wether to print the message with the warning color tag (i.e. red)
result(result_num, text, mod=0)¶

TOOD: document function

Parameters:
  • result_num (int) – type of result?
  • text (string) – indication of the type of message
  • mod (int or None) – some function
snippets(num, configfile='default_setup.ini')¶

Type code snippets

Parameters:
  • num (int) – the id of the code snippet to play
  • configfile (str) – the name of the config file to parse
tremolo(pianoregister, value)¶

Type the tremolo command + the tremolo-value

Parameters:
  • pianoregister (string) – the pianoregister the tremolo is played in. Values are: ‘hi_1’, ‘hi_2’, ‘mid_1’, ‘mid_2’, ‘low_1’, ‘low_2’, ‘low_3’.
  • value (int) – the tremolo value as distance between the notes

CodeKlavier.Motifs module¶

Motifs in Dictionaries.

Here you can define the name of the motif and the series of midi-notes that make up that motif. Way more efficient than an unjustified class.

CodeKlavier.hello_classes module¶

classes for Hello World. First prototype of the CodeKlavier

Bases: object

CodeKlavier.midi_delegate module¶

midi_delegate.py

This file opens a delegate between nodejs and python’s CodeKlavier. Used for the installation at NKK 2017

i.e. MIDI note order doesn’t matter

Compare the passed array to a given array

i.e. detect if a motif is played

count_notes(array, debug=False)¶

See if notes are repeated in the passed array so as to be considered a tremolo. Can detect tremolos and also triple tremolos, or unisons.

TODO: descrine input and output

get_range(notes, time, debug=False)¶

Get the range between the notes played in a time window

TODO: show range every iteration

memorize(midinote, length, debug=False, debugname='Motippets', conditional='off')¶

Store the incoming midi notes by appending to the memory array.

Parameters:
  • midinote – the incoming MIDI note message
  • length (int) – the size of the array to store the midinotes
  • debug (boolean) – flag to print console debug messages
  • debugname (string) – prefix for the debug messages
  • conditional (string) – if a parallel buffer is filled in for the conditional functions
parse_midi(event, section, ck_deltatime=0, target=0)¶

Parse the midi signal and process it depending on the register.

Parameters:
  • event (tuple) – describes the midi event that was received
  • section (string) – the MIDI piano range (i.e. low register, mid or high)
  • ck_deltatime (float) – the deltatime between icoming note-on MIDI messages
  • target (int) – target the parsing for a specific snippet. 0 is no target
tremolo_value(notes, pianosection, deltatime, deltatolerance, target, debug=False)¶

Get the interval of a given tremolo.

Parameters:
  • notes (array) – Array of notes to be analysed
  • pianosection (string) – the name of the piano range (i.e. low, mid, etc)
  • deltatime (float) – the time between the received midi messages
  • deltatolerance (float) – the deltatime max threshold
  • target (int) – integer that references the targeted snippet
  • debug (boolean) – wheather to show or hide debug messages
